blocks.text: To find the values of the " space rate of change of velocity " for three separate space intervals.
Considering the displacement from 14 to 10 ft, the change in the velocity corresponding to this change of position is 14 - 10, i.e., 4 ft per sec.

blocks.description: This shows the calculation for the change in velocity in terms of feet per second.
This equation calculates the change in position in feet.

blocks.text: or, the change of velocity thus found for change of position = 5 - 8, per sec. and rate of change of velocity (for this period) = -8 ft per sec.
Again, if space changes from 0 to 12, the change in the velocity; for this period is 12 - 0 = 12 ft per sec.

blocks.latex: \text{Similarly, the rate of change of y, whilst 5 remains constant is} \frac{\Delta v}{\Delta s} = 7 \text{ ft, per foot.}
blocks.description: This demonstrates the rate of change of velocity with respect to the change in space.

blocks.latex: (a) \text{ As } s \text{ changes from 0 to 12, } \Delta v = 12 - 0 = 12
blocks.description: This shows the change in velocity as space changes from 0 to 12.

blocks.latex: (b) \text{ As } s \text{ changes from 0 to 5, } \Delta v = 8 - 5 = 3
blocks.description: This equation computes the change in velocity for the space change from 0 to 5.
This states the expression for change in velocity, but some text is unrecognized.
This appears to summarize the change in velocity under certain conditions but contains unrecognized text.
